Text.valUnicode: View or add Contacts and Phone numbers.
Fill the XML file with data from the SQL Address Book.
Displays the raw XML internal data.

ExpSyntax.val: 'XM06: How Do I Modify an Existing XML Document?'

Text.val: The Main Source in this instance is an XML file.
The file name is specified in the Main Source properties.
You do not have to work with the NodeId or ParentId, so they are not included here.
When a new record is created, a timestamp is used to create a unique record id.
The "Contact" record is the first level below the Root, so there is no need to link this record to anything
above it (Magic will handle the link to the Root automatically).
For the purposes of sorting data, there is a Seq number on the phone list, so that the newest additions
move to the bottom. This is not required at all; the phone number index is not unique, and XML has no
need for unique indexes at all.
When the Add Contact button is pressed, the program is switched to Modify
mode and then to Create Line. The alternative would be to have a separate program
to do more detailed data entry.
Normally, when a record is deleted, the subrecords also need to be deleted
However, in XML documents, this is handled automatically by Magic.
Passing in the record ID forces the Subform to refresh whenever the cursor moves down the parent list.
Again, the NodeId and ParentId are not required, so they are not included.
The /Record_ID is the internal field used by this program to link the Phone numbers to the Contact.
While XML does not require such linking, it is required here so Magic can deal with individual record levels.
The /Record_ID range specifies to Magic that this set of records belongs to the parent record being displayed,
so it will be stored correctly in the XML.
Normally this would not be displayed to the user, but for training purposes, it is on the table so you can
see how it works.
The Seq number below is not required, but it makes the last phone number sort to the bottom of the list,
which is what feels more natural to the user.
Store the last phone Seq#
If this record was modified, go back to query mode
